metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5377 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A memory corruption vulnerability in Skia that can occur when using transforms to make gradients, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 51.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '51.0.1+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
